snippet: Mr. Trump drew back from his call for a mandatory registry of Muslims in the United States, capping a week where candidates discussed their approaches to terrorism.
abstract: Republican presidential hopeful Donald J Trump draws criticism from Democrats, some Republicans and religious leaders over his support for national Muslim database; Jeb Bush immediately voices his displeasure with idea, while Sed Ted Cruz, who hopes to inherit Trump’s supporters should his campaign falter, gently dissociates himself from notion.

byline.original: By MAGGIE HABERMAN and RICHARD PÉREZ-PEÑA
byline.contributor: Jason Horowitz and Matt Flegenheimer contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Mr. Trump drew back from his call for a mandatory registry of Muslims in the United States, capping a week where candidates discussed their approaches to terrorism.

headline.main: Donald Trump Sets Off a Furor With Call to Register Muslims in the U.S.
headline.print_headline: Muslim List? Call by Trump Draws Outrage
